kodkod.util.nodes
Class Nodes

java.lang.Object
  kodkod.util.nodes.Nodes

public final class Nodes
extends java.lang.Object

Provides utility methods for constructing balanced Kodkod trees using associative operators.

Author:
Emina Torlak

Method Detail

roots

public static java.util.Set<Formula> roots(Formula formula)
Returns the roots of the given formula. In other words, breaks up the given formula into its conjunctive components, {f0, ..., fk}, such that, for all 0<=i<=k, fi is not a conjunction and [[f0 && ... && fk]] <=> [[formula]].

Returns:
subformulas, {f0, ..., fk}, of the given formula such that, for all 0<=i<=k, fi is not a conjuction and [[f0 && ... && fk]] <=> [[formula]].

and

public static Formula and(java.util.Collection<Formula> args)
Returns the conjunction of the given arguments, or Formula.TRUE if args is empty. The result of this method is the same as calling Nodes.apply(BinaryFormula.Operator.AND, Formula.TRUE, args).

Returns:
args.isEmpty() => Formula.TRUE else { t: T | [[t]] = AND [[args]] }

and

public static Formula and(Formula... args)
Returns the conjunction of the given arguments, or Formula.TRUE if args is empty. The result of this method is the same as calling Nodes.apply(BinaryFormula.Operator.AND, Formula.TRUE, args).

Returns:
args.length = 0 => Formula.TRUE else { t: T | [[t]] = AND [[args]] }

or

public static Formula or(java.util.Collection<Formula> args)
Returns the disjunction of the given arguments, or Formula.FALSE if args is empty. The result of this method is the same as calling Nodes.apply(BinaryFormula.Operator.OR, Formula.FALSE, args).

Returns:
args.isEmpty() => Formula.FALSE else { t: T | [[t]] = OR [[args]] }

or

public static Formula or(Formula... args)
Returns the disjunction of the given arguments, or Formula.FALSE if args is empty. The result of this method is the same as calling Nodes.apply(BinaryFormula.Operator.OR, Formula.FALSE, args).

Returns:
args.length = 0 => Formula.FALSE else { t: T | [[t]] = OR [[args]] }

apply

public static <T> T apply(BinaryOperator<T,T> op,
                          java.util.Collection<T> args)
Returns the result of applying the given binary operator to the specified arguments, or null if args is empty. The returned tree is guaranteed to be balanced (with respect to the nodes in args).

Returns:
args.isEmpty() => null else { t: T | [[t]] = [[op]] [[args]] }
requires:
op.associative()
args can be combined using the given operator

apply

public static <T> T apply(BinaryOperator<T,T> op,
                          T defaultValue,
                          java.util.Collection<T> args)
Returns the result of applying the given binary operator to the specified arguments, or the given defaultValue if args is empty. The returned tree is guaranteed to be balanced (with respect to the nodes in args).

Returns:
args.isEmpty() => defaultValue else { t: T | [[t]] = [[op]] [[args]] }
requires:
op.associative()
args can be combined using the given operator

apply

public static <T> T apply(BinaryOperator<T,T> op,
                          T... args)
Returns the result of applying the given binary operator to the specified arguments, or null if args is empty. The returned tree is guaranteed to be balanced (with respect to the nodes in args).

Returns:
args.length = 0 => null else { t: T | [[t]] = [[op]] [[args]] }
requires:
op.associative()
args can be combined using the given operator

apply

public static <T> T apply(BinaryOperator<T,T> op,
                          T defaultValue,
                          T... args)
Returns the result of applying the given binary operator to the specified arguments, or the given defaultValue if args is empty. The returned tree is guaranteed to be balanced (with respect to the nodes in args).

Returns:
args.length = 0 => defaultValue else { t: T | [[t]] = [[op]] [[args]] }
requires:
op.associative()
args can be combined using the given operator

balance

public static <N extends Node> N balance(N node)
Balances the binary components of the given node and returns the resulting (semantically equivalent) node. Balancing preserves sharing relationships between nodes.

Returns:
balanced version of the given node
